articles.description: People who have been sick with COVID-19 may need only one dose of the normally two-shot vaccines. If that became policy it could extend vaccine supplies, but logistical challenges are daunting.
articles.title: Single Shot Of Coronavirus Vaccine After Illness Could Extend Supply : Shots - Health News - NPR

articles.author: Zack Budryk
